column5: Hey guys I might be picking up a boat but it will probably be stored outside for the first little bit so I'm wondering where I can get a decent boat cover as well as if there's anything I should look for/stay away from when buying one. Any help is appreciated. Thanks!
I usually buy the canvas ones from Cdn Tire or wally world---seem ok---bout 200 bucks for my boat  DO STAY AWAY FROM THOSE CHEAP PLASTIC TARP ONES_______GAAAARRRRBBBAAAGE!!!!!
Cabelas and BassPro also offer decent covers. I second  to stay away from the cheap plastic covers.
Princess Auto - StormPro Heavy duty covers and also motor covers.  cheapest place to buy it.
Buddy at work bought one at Costco a month ago and is very happy with it. $100  Basic outboard cover at Princess is the same as the bass pro but with different packaging, $10 cheaper
Hey guys,  Thanks for all the replies I appreciate the help! I might try the princess auto or the costco one as its down the street; and I'll stay away from plastic tarps.
You missed CTC had them on sale for 1/2 price last week and those come with a 4 year warranty to boot.

You missed CTC had them on sale for 1/2 price last week and those come with a 4 year warranty to boot.  Damn. I must have missed that page in the flyer..oh well, I'm going to compare the covers from the 2 stores and decide which one will be best for me.
Princess Auto has same warranty as CT. I am really happy with StormPro cover. They are even cheaper on amazon.ca.
CT has Dryguard Boat covers on sale starting later this week. $150 off!!!
CT has Dryguard Boat covers on sale starting later this week. $150 off!!! How you knowing this Dave???I used to know a month in advance where I once worked.lol.  Top secret!!

How you knowing this Dave???I used to know a month in advance where I once worked.lol.  Top secret!!
